newsitem.title: USA: USWC spot prods are mixed, ARCO rumor lifts diesel.
newsitem.headline: USWC spot prods are mixed, ARCO rumor lifts diesel.

text.p: U.S. West Coast spot product prices were mixed Tuesday, with gasoline pressured by stable refinery operations, except for ARCO's Los Angeles plant, which traders claimed had problems making diesel.

"I think they're got a hydrocracker problem," one trader said, noting CARB diesel in L.A. rose one cent overnight to sell at 80 cents a gallon Tuesday. On Monday, a rumor circulated that ARCO had problems blending up the distillate.
In gasoline markets, prices have lost support since Tosco and their oil workers on Saturday agreed to a labor contract, ending the threat of strike at four California refineries.
Low sulphur diesel edged up 0.25 cents a gallon to 67.75/68.75 cents in early discussion, helped by the ARCO rumor.

CARB gasoline in Los Angeles shed a 1.50 cent from Monday, with traders talking the grade between 81.50 and 83.50 cents a gallon. San Francisco ranged a half-cent under L.A., losing 2.50 cents since Monday.
